snippet: American and Canadian regulators who try to scrutinize Chinese corporations generally face a huge task getting cooperation from Chinese authorities.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column notes that American and Canadian regulators face a huge task in obtaining even the most basic accounting information about Chinese companies from country's authorities; cites case in which an extensive audit by Ernst & Young of Sino-Forest Corporation failed to discover that company had virtually no assets.
lead_paragraph: American and Canadian regulators who try to scrutinize Chinese corporations generally face a huge task getting cooperation from Chinese authorities.
